thread.title: The Top 20 Influencers From FINCON You Must Follow On Twitter
thread.title_full: The Top 20 Influencers From FINCON You Must Follow On Twitter

author: Jeff Rose
title: The Top 20 Influencers From FINCON You Must Follow On Twitter
text:
Let the financial geeks unite!The fifth annual Financial Bloggers Conference , more commonly known as FINCON, just wrapped up in Charlotte with more than 800 self-proclaimed financial geeks in attendance (and yes, I am one of those proud geeks).
Always love speaking at #fincon15 . Can't wait until San Diego next year!! pic.twitter.com/WqY1CmnGtx
— Jeff Rose, CFP® (@jjeffrose) September 20, 2015 With so many amazing personal finance bloggers and experts in attendance, it might seen impossible to know who you need to follow.Don't worry. I got your back.Here's a breakdown of the top 20 Influencers from FINCON you must follow on [entity display="Twitter" type="organization" subtype="company" active="true" activated="true" deactivated="false" key="twitter" ticker="TWTR" exchange="NYSE" natural_id="fred/company/102047"]Twitter[/entity]. 1. Jennifer Barrett Jennifer is an award winning journalist and digital strategist. She is Personal Finance Editor for CNBC Digital. Previously she was Editor-in-Chief at DailyWorth, a financial media company targeting women, and also held posts at Newsweek, Dow Jones, The Street and The New York Times.Jennifer has also co-authored two personal finance books. A recent tweet: How much will Gen Y receive from Social Security? Probably more than they think. @bytomanderson @CNBC http://t.co/OLHNfVDikZ #socialsecurity
— Jennifer Barrett (@JBarrettNYC) September 16, 2015 Website: CNBC.com 2. Alan Moore and Michael Kitces Alan and Michael are the twin forces behind XY Planning Network, who bill themselves as the "the leading organization of fee-only financial advisors who specialize in helping members of Gen X and Gen Y." XY Planning Network offers virtual services so you can find and connect with your ideal advisor, regardless of location. The service charges a flat monthly fee and no commissions.The network includes financial advisors who offer comprehensive financial planning that goes beyond investment management alone.Individually, Alan is the proprietor at Alan Moore Financial.com, and president of Serenity Financial Consulting, a fee-only RIA and location independent financial planning firm. Alan has been recognized by Investment News as a top “40 Under 40″ in financial planning, and by Wealth Management as one of a “The 10 to Watch in 2015″.Michael offers "One nerd's perspective on the financial planning world". He is the publisher of The Kitces Report and the blog Nerd's Eye View . A recent tweet: "If you're going to serve a niche, you should actually do something different for those people than everyone else." @BrandonMarcott #XYPN15
— XY Planning Network (@XYPlanning) September 16, 2015 Website: XYPlanningNetwork 3. Jeff Goins Jeff is the author of four books including the national bestseller, The Art of Work , published in March of 2015. He also teaches online courses, including the popular Tribe Writers. A recent tweet: When you aren't sure what to do, be sure of what you are doing. http://t.co/lobhK9kT94 pic.twitter.com/sO4NXIFbls
— Jeff Goins (@JeffGoins) September 15, 2015 Website: GoinsWriter.com 4. Mandi Woodruff Mandi is Personal Finance Correspondent at [entity display="Yahoo" type="organization" subtype="company" active="true" activated="true" deactivated="false" key="yahoo" ticker="YHOO" exchange="NASDAQ" natural_id="fred/company/4786"]Yahoo[/entity]!Finance, where she writes about money, income inequality, retirement, college and more.This month she's launching a new podcast, Brown Ambition . A recent tweet: My biggest mistake was ignoring my credit history http://t.co/sgmltnZ0No via @brightcents
— Mandi Woodruff (@mandiwoodruff) September 10, 2015 Website: Mandi.nyc 5. Patrice C.Washington Known as the Wisdom & Wealth Money Maven (hence the name of her website), Patrice is founder of [entity display="Seek" type="organization" subtype="company" active="true" activated="true" deactivated="false" key="seek" natural_id="fred/company/102068"]Seek[/entity] Wisdom Find Wealth , a personal finance training and development company created to move individuals from debt management to money mastery with an innovative focus on showing them how to earn more money by discovering their purpose. A recent tweet: “Savings makes the difference between a crisis and an inconvenience. You choose.” #Quote: #RealMoneyAnswers
— Patrice C Washington (@SeekWisdomPCW) September 16, 2015 Website: BooktheMoneyMaven.com 6. Grant Baldwin Grant Baldwin has been a full-time speaker for 10 years, conducting over 400 paid speaking engagements, selling over 30,000 copies of his self published book, and presenting to more than 350,000 people in live audiences.He is committed to helping other speakers learn how to master the business and offers a course through his website. A recent tweet: "Sometimes we find our voice when we most feel like we're losing them." @allyvest #TribeConf
— Grant Baldwin (@grantbaldwin) August 29, 2015 Website: GrantBaldwin.com 7. Farnoosh Torabi Torabi (nicknamed "Noosh") is a financial reporter, money strategist, TV and web host.She is a financial correspondent for Nerdwallet.com, frequent contributor for DailyWorth, Yahoo! and The Today Show and former contributing editor at Money Magazine.Torabi is author of three books: "You're So Money -– Live Rich Even When You're Not," "Psych Yourself Rich: Get the Mindset & Discipline You Need to Build Your Financial Life" and "When She Makes More: 10 Rules for Breadwinning Women" (an Amazon #1 Best Seller).She hosts a daily podcast, So Money (see website link below), which was voted the #1 financial podcast of 2015 and recently selected as a “Top Podcast to Grow Your Business” by Inc. Magazine. A recent tweet: What ?s do you have for me this week about student loans, retirement or something else? #AskFarnoosh on #SoMoney http://t.co/ZcU7EagXR6
— Farnoosh Torabi (@FARNOOSH) September 15, 2015 Website: So Money with Farnoosh Torabi 8. Barry Ritholtz Barry Ritholtz is the founder and chief investment officer of Ritholtz Wealth Management, a financial planning and asset management firm. Started in 2013, the firm has over $175 million in assets.He also writes a daily column for [entity display="Bloomberg" type="organization" subtype="company" active="true" activated="true" deactivated="false" key="bloomberg" natural_id="fred/company/11849"]Bloomberg[/entity] View and a twice monthly column on Personal Finance and Investing for The Washington Post. A recent tweet: About Time . . . Humans have difficulty simply being a client that lets time work as an agent on their behalf http://t.co/oR2YqVfVx1
— Barry Ritholtz (@ritholtz) September 13, 2015 Website: Ritholtz.com 9. Kyle Taylor Kyle is the founder of the The Penny Hoarder, a site dedicated to helping readers "earn money, save money and grow your money". The site has hundreds of articles to help you do each. The Penny Hoarder has - get this - over 1.2 million subscribers, so clearly Kyle and his team are doing a lot of things right. He also won Blog of the Year at the conference's Plutus Awards, a ceremony recognizing the top bloggers in the niche A recent tweet: Excited for #FinCon15 ! RT @FinCon : How to Get Millions of Visitors to Your Personal Finance Blog @ThePennyHoarder http://t.co/kuuDatortd
— The Penny Hoarder (@thepennyhoarder) September 10, 2015 Website: ThePennyHoarder.com 10. Erin Chase Erin is the founder of 5 Dollar Dinners where she blogs about how to spend a whole lot less of your hard earned money on groceries, so you can use the savings to help improve your finances, such as paying off debt, saving for a vacation, paying for something special, or whatever your financial goals or dream may be. A recent tweet: What if I told you that you could save $200 a month, every month? Doesn’t an extra $2400 in your pocket next year... http://t.co/qPdATg6gEq
— Erin Chase (@5dollardinners) September 13, 2015 Website: 5DollarDinners.com 11. Bob Lotich Bob launched ChristianPF.com (recently changed to SeedTime.com), a personal finance blog he created to let readers get control of their money, pay off debt, save more and give more than they ever dreamed possible -- with all advice given from a Christian-centric perspective. The site draws 1.2 million visitors per month, and has had 22 million visitors since it was launched.It has been featured in Kiplinger's, INC, Forbes, Time, CBN, Yahoo Finance, and many others. A recent tweet: If the richest man in the world gave you money advice, would you listen? http://t.co/Fp07VgCdOM pic.twitter.com/UMmlvwCjGZ
— SeedTime ChristianPF (@ChristianPF) September 2, 2015 Website: SeedTime.com 12. Omar Zenhom Omar is co-founder of the The $100 MBA , a program designed to challenge the "MBA system" and to change business education forever. The program uses practical and actionable business education, with high quality, expert video training. There is also a blog and a supportive community of business builders that help you stay motivated and provide feedback. A recent tweet: Hire for culture. Train for culture. It’s important to hire people whose outlook is conducive to #CustomerService . http://t.co/4heDJPlPRV
— Omar Zenhom (@BizRepublic) September 16, 2015 Website: The $100 MBA 13. Mandy Rose Mandy is a mom of 3 boys but don't let that fool you. She's also a fierce entrepreneur and Instagram marketing maven. She's the co-founder of the former subscription box service Happy Mommy Box but has moved on to focus on building her tribe in the fitness and marriage space.And yes, she's my spouse and the reason why I'm able to accomplish all that I do. A recent tweet: Who you are is more important than what you do... #rememberthat
— houseofrose (@houseofrose) September 20, 2015 Website: Houseofroseblog.com 14. Nick Loper "Build Job-Free Income" - that's the motto of Nick's blog, Side Hustle Nation. . The blog provides hundreds of articles from real people and how they're making money from their side hustles, working toward the day when they can break out of the 9-to-5 grind. Nick also offers The Side Hustle Show, a weekly podcast that follows the same theme. A recent tweet: How to Make $1000 In Side Income On Craigslist This Month http://t.co/LrUUFCHtC0 #sidehustle — Nick Loper (@nloper) September 16, 2015 Website: SideHustleNation.com 15. Andrea Woroch Andrea is a nationally-recognized consumer and money-saving expert. She regularly contributes to leading national and regional news stories. She has appeared on NBC's Today Show, Dr. OZ, Good Morning America, FOX & Friends, MSNBC, CNN, ABC News with Diane Sawyer , and has been Quote: d in dozens of major publications. . A recent tweet: The Staggering Price of Giving Kids the 'Perfect' Life — and the Toll it Takes on Your Marriage https://t.co/4xWlcVo7Pz via @YahooParenting — Andrea Woroch (@AndreaWoroch) September 16, 2015 Website: AndreaWoroch.com 16. J.D. Roth J.D. is the founder of Get Rich Slowly, a blog that chronicled his journey into smart money management. J. D. no longer owns GRS, but by the time he sold the blog, it had over a million monthly visitors. He has since been blogging at JD Roth.com, but is launching his newest blog, MoneyBoss.com. Money Boss is site where he will share his years of experience in managing finances. The purpose of the site is to help you master your money so that "you can achieve your goals sooner rather than later". A recent tweet: Not all pro athletes squander big bucks. Here's one who has set a modest budget and created a HUGE "personal profit": http://t.co/w5Mpy4pbuS
— J.D. Roth (@jdroth) August 10, 2015 Website: MoneyBoss.com 17. Tiffany Aliche Tiffany is an award-winning teacher of financial empowerment, and the author of of two #1 Amazon bestsellers, The One Week Budget and Live Richer Challenge. In fact, in 2014, Tiffany founded the Live Richer Challenge Movement , which is a virtual community of thousands of women from 50 states and 60+ countries.She blogs about personal finance for The Huffington Post and US News and World Report, and has been featured in numerous other publications. A recent tweet: Think u don't have enough $ 2 do the things u want? (travel, buy a home/car, start a biz). Yes, u do! Learn how here: http://t.co/VBXlVZqR0M — Tiff The Budgetnista (@TheBudgetnista) September 21, 2015 Website: The Budgetnista 18. Pat Flynn Pat is the founder and proprietor of Smart Passive Income , a website dedicated to helping visitors enter the world of online business, blogging, and passive income.The motto of Pat’s site: I’m the crash test dummy of online business, sharing what works (and what doesn’t) so you know exactly how to build your business better. The site covers everything you need to know about blogging tips, affiliate marketing, social media, podcasting and even lifestyle. A recent tweet: How to Launch a New Website (with a Bang!) - One of the most popular posts on SPI: http://t.co/AfVZhW1SAh
— Pat Flynn (@PatFlynn) September 15, 2015 Website: SmartPassiveIncome.com 19. Lynnette Khalfani Cox Lynnette is a personal finance expert, speaker, author of NY Times Bestseller Zero D , and the force behind The Money Coach , which is a financial education company dedicated to increasing financial literacy worldwide and to better educate the public about personal finances.The Money [entity display="Coach" type="organization" subtype="company" active="true" activated="true" deactivated="false" key="coach" ticker="COH" exchange="NYSE" natural_id="fred/company/1016"]Coach[/entity] offers books, e-books and digital content, videos, financial workshops or seminars, coaching, as well as spokespeople and media services. A recent tweet: Differential Tuition: A Hidden College Expense That Costs Families Thousands http://t.co/ywWYe9muug — Lynnette KhalfaniCox (@themoneycoach) September 16, 2015 Website: The Money Coach.net 20. Tracie, the Penny Pinchin Mom Tracie is the proud proprietor of the Penny Pinchin Mom blog, where she passionately blogs about helping people find ways to save money, clean up their financial lives, and get out of debt - all based on her own personal experience. Her blog maintains a coupon database, where she also gives away free stuff. She shows readers how to find the best deals, offers simple recipes and meal plans, and teaches about money. Tracie has been featured on Good Morning America, The New York Times, US News and World Report, BetterTV and other popular media outlets. A recent tweet: Just in case you missed this! How to Dispute Errors on your Free Credit Report http://t.co/No55HfMXQa
— Tracie (@PennyPinchinMom) September 22, 2015 Website: PennyPinchinMom.comIf you're a self-proclaimed finance geek like myself, then join the FINCON next year when we all meet in San Diego.
